content.description: Odd looking line but the best line on the wall. Amazing and solid rock throughout this pitch. Lunge off the dirt and layback up to a bolt. Continue up and right transferring through multiple systems (1 Bolt) to a mini finger dihedral. Pull out of the the dihedral, establishing on a stance and prepare to get creative. Esoteric moves right lead to a bolt and the crux. Funky cranking leads to the amazing patina edges on the beautiful bolted slab. More odd, but fun moves lead to a final edging move and a thank god jug at the first anchor at exactly 35 meters (Tie a knot). 3 more bolts leads to the end of the good rock and second anchor if you desire to see your journey through.
content.protection: 9 bolts (12 for the extension)   2X .3,.4,.5   #1   Optional #2 at the start
content.location: Right side of the wall. Look for a bolt about 15 feet off the ground.

content.description: The jaw dropping dihedral in the middle of the wall. Jam worlds most awkward hand crack/fist crack/offwidth/flare up to a rooflet. Amazing, bizarre, fun cranking through windows in the rock leads to bizarrem fun cranking up patina edges (Bolts). A cryptic moves lead to a glorious jug, and the chains.
content.protection: Single set of nuts   2x #3   3X #2   1x #1   Green c3   Optional small fingers   4 Bolts   2 Bolt Anchor
content.location: Directly behind Juniper tree in the middle of the wall.

content.description: The jaw dropping dihedral on the left side of the wall. Amazing featured stone, varied movement and traddy mctradington stemming lead you up this classic thin finger and tips crack. Not to be missed, this slightly spicy line is solid gold.
content.protection: Singles 00 to #3 with 3x Red C3, 3X ,4, and 3x ,5.   Single set of nuts   2 Bolt Anchor   70m rope mandatory
content.location: Up and left of The Holey Dihedral.
